util.config.props

Class JPropAccessorFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.config.props.JPropAccessorFactory

  • public class JPropAccessorFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory methods to create typed property accessors for common cases.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public static <T> JPropAccessor<T> make(JPropKey key,
                                        java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,T> fromString)
        Convenience factory method to create an accessor with object to string conversion done using String's valueOf method.
        Parameters:
        key - the property key.
        fromString - converts the property raw string value in the Java Properties store to a T.
        Returns:
        a new accessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • makeString

        public static JPropAccessor<java.lang.String> makeString(JPropKey key)
        Convenience factory method to create a string accessor. String values are read as is from the property store, whereas string values are written using String's valueOf method.
        Parameters:
        key - the property key.
        Returns:
        a new accessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • makeBool

        public static JPropAccessor<java.lang.Boolean> makeBool(JPropKey key)
        Convenience factory method to create a boolean accessor. String values are read from the property store using Boolean's valueOf method, whereas boolean values are written using String's valueOf method.
        Parameters:
        key - the property key.
        Returns:
        a new accessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • makeInt

        public static JPropAccessor<java.lang.Integer> makeInt(JPropKey key)
        Convenience factory method to create an integer accessor. String values are read from the property store using Integer's valueOf method, whereas integer values are written using String's valueOf method.
        Parameters:
        key - the property key.
        Returns:
        a new accessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • makeURI

        public static JPropAccessor<java.net.URI> makeURI(JPropKey key)
        Convenience factory method to create an URI accessor. String values are read from the property store using URI's constructor, whereas URI values are written using URI's toASCIIString method.
        Parameters:
        key - the property key.
        Returns:
        a new accessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • makeEnum

        public static <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> JPropAccessor<T> makeEnum(java.lang.Class<T> enumType,
                                                                      JPropKey key)
        Convenience factory method to create an enum accessor. String values are read from the property store using the enum's valueOf method, whereas enum values are written using the enum's name method.
        Parameters:
        enumType - the the enum type for which to create the accessor.
        key - the property key.
        Returns:
        a new accessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
